addSwapIntervalsToAllowedList(uint32[],s.details: Will revert with: InvalidParams if the amount of swap intervals is different from the amount of descriptions passed ZeroInterval if any of the swap intervals is zero EmptyDescription if any of the descriptions is empty

returns.__allowedSwapIntervals: An array with all allowed swap intervals

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

returns._0: Whether the given swap interval is currently allowed

returns._loanParameters: All parameters that affect a loan

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setFeeRecipient(address).details: Will revert with ZeroAddress if the zero address is passed

setNFTDescriptor(address).details: Will revert with ZeroAddress if the zero address is passed

setOracle(address).details: Will revert with ZeroAddress if the zero address is passed

returns._swapParameters: All parameters that affect a swap

feeRecipient.return: _feeRecipient The address of the fee recipient

returns._0: _feeRecipient The address of the fee recipient

EmptyDescription().notice: Thrown when trying a description for a new swap interval is empty

HighFee().notice: Thrown when trying to set a fee higher than the maximum allowed

InvalidParams().notice: Thrown when trying to support new swap intervals, but the amount of descriptions doesn't match

ZeroInterval().notice: Thrown when trying to support a new swap interval of value zero

FeeRecipientSet(address).notice: Emitted when a new fee recipient is set

LoanFeeSet(uint32).notice: Emitted when a new loan fee is set

NFTDescriptorSet(address).notice: Emitted when a new NFT descriptor is set

OracleSet(address).notice: Emitted when a new oracle is set

SwapFeeSet(uint32).notice: Emitted when a new swap fee is set

SwapIntervalsAllowed(uint32[],string[]).notice: Emitted when new swap intervals are allowed

SwapIntervalsForbidden(uint32[]).notice: Emitted when some swap intervals are no longer allowed

FEE_PRECISION().notice: Returns the precision used for fees

MAX_FEE().notice: Returns the max fee that can be set for either swap or loans

addSwapIntervalsToAllowedList(uint32[],s.notice: Adds new swap intervals to the allowed list

allowedSwapIntervals().notice: Returns a list of all the allowed swap intervals

feeRecipient().notice: Returns the address of the fee recipient

intervalDescription(uint32).notice: Returns the description for a given swap interval

isSwapIntervalAllowed(uint32).notice: Returns whether a swap interval is currently allowed

loanParameters().notice: Returns a compilation of all parameters that affect a loan

removeSwapIntervalsFromAllowedList(uint3.notice: Removes some swap intervals from the allowed list

setFeeRecipient(address).notice: Sets a new fee recipient address

swapParameters().notice: Returns a compilation of all parameters that affect a swap
